lines.text: I'll take your bag.
Oh, but I wouldn't trouble you.
Oh, but never a day goes by without trouble for me.
Oh, but I don't know you!
You'll be forgiven for that.
And I'm not in the habit of talking to strangers.
And right you are.
Seems like I ought to place you, but I can't.
Can I be of any help?
Where you from?
Well, almost any place you can get and some you can't.
In what capacity?
Well, that depends on where I go.
Know doubt you've got something quite special off in Bancroft.
That depends on Bancroft.
I can ask more questions and find out less from you then any man I ever knew.
Kind of a natural gift.
Well, you've been accused of stealing cattle.
Won't they ever get tired of accusing me of that?
They're about set to try something else.
Who is?
Mr. Sabercool for one.
Sabercool?
Yeah, he's missing about 300 head of cattle; claims they're on your range.
Well, he'll have to prove it in court!
He favors a shotgun... says it's more final - there's no appeal.
Don't let him bluff ya!
Buckshot is no bluff, Mr. Withers.
Tom, we want you to resign at once!
Resign? With that fellow loose?
If you'd been more capable, you'd have got this man before he got my money.
Well, if you tell me who he is, Mr. Babcock, I'll serve him with a subpoena.
[before he can see who he's shooting at, Velvet fires a round at Mike]
You're as touchy as a girl.
Always ready for company.
You don't encourage any.
Why didn't you tell me you play the piano?
Because it doesn't any difference to anyone but me.
But you must have a reason and I want to know why. You better tell me.
I stopped!
But why?

Because I wanted to be the best. It takes money for lessons; I didn't have any. You know what it's like to have talent - a lot of talent? I tried to kill mine... but it wouldn't die. I hate it, but sometimes I just got to play.
You aren't afraid of anything are you?
Not anything that's alive.
Well, we won't raise the dead, will we?
Where are we gonna get some grub at?
We'll pick up supplies in Clarksville.
Where's that?
Right where they built it. Where did you think it would be?
You wouldn't think those cowboys would treat a town like that.
Must have been devil drunk. A high hangin' to them.
What's this for? We ain't done nuthin' in this territory!
We got a prejudice against murder.
lines.character: R.B. Davis, Justice of the Peace

lines.text: You better stay overnight with us and get rested up.
lines.character: R.B. Davis, Justice of the Peace

lines.text: He'll be over the border if I do. He's already got a head start by shootin' my horse.
Well, he'll make good time over the mesa, but Gunsight Ridge will slow him up.
lines.character: R.B. Davis, Justice of the Peace

lines.text: He'll never let go of that money. I'll put my shadow on him.
[unknowingly, the farm girl picks up Velvet's bag of loot]
My, this is heavy!
It's got everything I need.
You stay right where you are, Mister, and don't move.
All right, but be careful. I wouldn't want you to shoot yourself.
I know how to shoot.
Well, I wouldn't want you to shoot me, either.
Molly, I can't forgive myself. If I'd done what I knew was best for your father, he'd be here right now.
You gave Father back his pride. That was all that mattered to him.
[last lines]
Molly, they've asked me to stay.
What have you told them?
I haven't told them.
I want you to stay.
Then I'll tell them.
You will?
I will.
